name: Microgram
intro: Micro weight unit, suitable for measuring trace reagents and trace element content in medicine and chemical experiments.

name: Milligram
intro: Commonly used in the medical field, for describing tablet doses, trace element detection results, and other scenarios.

name: Gram
intro: Basic metric weight unit, adapted for weighing daily small objects, measuring food ingredients, and weighing small precious metal items.

name: Kilogram
intro: Core SI unit, the mainstream standard for daily shopping, weight measurement, and industrial material measurement.

name: Tonne
intro: Bulk cargo measurement unit, suitable for describing large-scale weight of logistics, minerals, and industrial raw materials.

name: Quintal
intro: Commonly used in some European countries, adapted for batch measurement of agricultural products and light industry raw materials.

name: Grain
intro: Special unit for jewelry and ammunition measurement, mostly used for precise weighing of precious metal jewelry and firearm ammunition.

name: Dram
intro: Traditional small weight unit in the UK and US, adapted for measuring spices, medicinal materials, and small precious metal jewelry.

name: Ounce
intro: Daily weight unit in the UK and US, often used for measuring food, cosmetics, and ordinary precious metals.

name: Pound
intro: Mainstream weight unit in the UK and US, adapted for daily measurement scenarios such as body weight, parcels, and retail goods.

name: Stone
intro: Traditional body weight unit in the UK, mostly used for colloquial description of human weight and livestock breeding measurement.

name: US Ton (Short Ton)
intro: US bulk cargo measurement standard, adapted for cross-border trade scenarios of logistics and industrial raw materials.

name: UK Ton (Long Ton)
intro: Bulk cargo unit in the UK and Commonwealth countries, suitable for maritime transportation and mineral trade measurement.

name: Troy Ounce
intro: Exclusive measurement unit for precious metals, the core standard for trading jewelry/raw materials such as gold, silver, and platinum.

name: Carat
intro: Specialized in the jewelry industry, used for measuring the weight of precious stones such as diamonds and gemstones.

name: Chinese Li (Weight)
intro: Traditional small weight unit in China, mostly used for precise measurement of traditional Chinese medicinal materials and small precious metal items.

name: Chinese Fen
intro: Folk traditional unit in China, adapted for small-quantity measurement scenarios of traditional Chinese medicinal materials and gold and silver jewelry.

name: Chinese Qian
intro: Traditional weight unit in China, core used for measuring traditional Chinese medicine prescriptions and traditional gold and silver jewelry.

name: Chinese Liang
intro: Mainstream traditional folk unit in China, adapted for daily measurement of food ingredients, precious metals, and traditional Chinese medicinal materials.

name: Chinese Jin
intro: The most commonly used market weight unit in China, the core standard for daily grocery shopping, food weighing, and small commodity transactions.

name: Chinese Dan (Weight)
intro: Traditional bulk agricultural product measurement unit in China, mostly used for batch trading of grain, cotton, and other crops.
